soc.util

Class SOCFeatureSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.util.SOCFeatureSet

  • public class SOCFeatureSet
extends java.lang.Object
    Set of optional server features or client features that are currently active. Sent during connect via SOCVersion message fields. Each feature can be a flag (active or not) or, in v2.0.00 and newer, integer-valued.

    Server features were added in v1.1.19 (VERSION_FOR_SERVERFEATURES) to allow features (accounts, chat rooms, etc) to be turned off and to let clients know they're off. Earlier clients assume the server is using the features defined in 1.1.19. Use the SOCFeatureSet(true, true) constructor when connecting to a server older than 1.1.19. See that constructor's javadoc for the list of server features always assumed active before 1.1.19.

    Client features were added in v2.0.00 (VERSION_FOR_CLIENTFEATURES) to simplify development of third-party bots and clients, which might not want to implement all features. Earlier servers assume the client is using the features that standard JSettlers implements. Use the SOCFeatureSet(true, false) constructor when connecting to a client older than 2.0.00. See that constructor's javadoc for the list of client features always assumed active before 2.0.00.

    Feature name constants defined here are kept simple (lowercase alphanumerics, underscore, dash) for encoding into network message fields.

    Check active features with isActive(String) and/or getValue(String, int). Add a feature with add(String) or add(String, int).

    Locks: Not thread-safe. Caller must guard against potential multi-threaded modifications or access.

    Before v2.0.00 this class was SOCServerFeatures.

    Since:
    1.1.19
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>

      • VERSION_FOR_CLIENTFEATURES

        Minimum version (2.0.00) of client/server which send and recognize client features
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_ACCOUNTS

        public static final java.lang.String SERVER_ACCOUNTS
        Server feature User accounts defined in a persistent database. If this feature is active, nicknames and passwords are authenticated. Otherwise there are no passwords defined (SERVER_OPEN_REG).

        When this feature is active but the db is empty (new install), the server will tell clients that SERVER_OPEN_REG is active; see that feature's javadoc for details.

        The server can optionally be configured to require accounts, see SOCServer.PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_REQUIRED.

        Before v2.0.00 this constant was FEAT_ACCTS.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_CHANNELS

        public static final java.lang.String SERVER_CHANNELS
        Server feature Chat channels. If this feature is active, users are allowed to create chat channels. Otherwise no channels are allowed.

        Before v2.0.00 this constant was FEAT_CHANNELS.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_OPEN_REG

        public static final java.lang.String SERVER_OPEN_REG
        Server feature Open registration. If this feature is active, anyone can create their own user accounts. Otherwise only existing users can create new accounts (SERVER_ACCOUNTS).
        Special case during SERVER_ACCOUNTS server install:
        When a newly installed server requires authentication to create new accounts, but no accounts exist in the database yet, the server tells clients that SERVER_OPEN_REG is active so that SOCAccountClient won't ask for a username and password.

        Before v2.0.00 this constant was FEAT_OPEN_REG.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_6_PLAYERS

        public static final java.lang.String CLIENT_6_PLAYERS
        Client feature flag for 6-player games. If not set, client can only play 4-player games, not those where game option PL > 4.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_SEA_BOARD

        public static final java.lang.String CLIENT_SEA_BOARD
        Client feature flag for sea board layouts. If not set, client can only play the "classic" boards, not games where game option SBL is set.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_SCENARIO_VERSION

        public static final java.lang.String CLIENT_SCENARIO_VERSION
        Client scenario version (numeric feature). If not set, client doesn't support scenarios or game option SC. Clients supporting scenarios should set this feature's value to the JSettlers version having all scenarios they support: For example if the client supports all scenarios included in JSettlers 2.0.01, the value would be 2001.

        If client doesn't have this feature, server also assumes it doesn't support any scenario-related SOCGameOptions (the options starting with _SC_*, like _SC_3IP).

        Should not be newer (larger) than the client's reported version. If this value is newer than the client version, it will be reduced to match that.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_REQUESTS_DICE_RESULTS_FULLY_SENT

        public static final java.lang.String CLIENT_REQUESTS_DICE_RESULTS_FULLY_SENT
        Client feature flag for asking server to send the "end of dice result info" marker SOCSimpleAction (DICE_RESULTS_FULLY_SENT) in games this client has joined, by setting config flag SOCGame.clientRequestsDiceResultsFullySent. See that SOCSimpleAction javadoc for more details.

        Since this flag is rarely used, its name constant is descriptive (and unlikely to conflict later with something else) instead of short.

        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SEP_CHAR

        public static final char SEP_CHAR
        Separator character ';' between features in featureList. Chosen to avoid the sep_char and sep2_char separators defined in SOCMessage.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • SOCFeatureSet

        public SOCFeatureSet(boolean withOldDefaults,
                     boolean withOldDefaultsForServer)
        Create a new empty SOCFeatureSet, with none active or defaults active. After construction, use add(String) to add active features.
        Parameters:
        withOldDefaults - If false, nothing is active. If true, include the default features assumed active in servers or clients older than SOCFeatureSet support; see withOldDefaultsForServer
        withOldDefaultsForServer - Include features for an old server, not for old client:
        • If true, include features which were assumed always active in servers older than v1.1.19 (VERSION_FOR_SERVERFEATURES): SERVER_ACCOUNTS, SERVER_CHANNELS, SERVER_OPEN_REG.
        • If false, include feature which was assumed always active in clients older than v2.0.00 (VERSION_FOR_CLIENTFEATURES): CLIENT_6_PLAYERS.
        • Ignored unless withOldDefaults is set.

      • SOCFeatureSet

        public SOCFeatureSet(java.lang.String encodedList)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new SOCFeatureSet from an encoded list; useful at client.
        Parameters:
        encodedList - List from getEncodedList(), or null or "" for none (not ";;")
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if encodedList is not empty but doesn't start and end with SEP_CHAR

      • SOCFeatureSet

        public SOCFeatureSet(SOCFeatureSet feats)
              throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Create a new SOCFeatureSet by copying another.
        Parameters:
        feats - Copy from this to create the new SOCFeatureSet
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if feats == null

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive(java.lang.String featureName)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Is this feature active?
        Parameters:
        featureName - A defined feature name, such as SERVER_ACCOUNTS
        Returns:
        True if featureName is in the features list, as either a flag or an int-valued feature
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if featureName is null or ""
        See Also:
        getValue(String, int)

      • getValue

        public int getValue(java.lang.String featureName,
                    int dflt)
        Get the int value of this feature, if active.
        Parameters:
        featureName - A defined int-valued feature name
        dflt - Default value if feature isn't found or is a boolean flag. If value can't be parsed as an integer, returns dflt.
        Returns:
        Feature's int value or dflt
        See Also:
        isActive(String)

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String featureName)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add this active feature flag. Must not already be in the set: Does not check for duplicates.
        Parameters:
        featureName - A defined feature flag name, such as SERVER_ACCOUNTS or CLIENT_SEA_BOARD
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if featureName is null or "" or contains '=' or ';' (SEP_CHAR)
        See Also:
        add(String, int), remove(String)

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String featureName,
                int val)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add this int-valued active feature. Must not already be in the set: Does not check for duplicates.
        Parameters:
        featureName - A defined int-valued feature name, such as CLIENT_SCENARIO_VERSION
        val - Feature's value; any integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if featureName is null or "" or contains '=' or ';' (SEP_CHAR)
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        add(String), remove(String)

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String featureName)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Remove this feature if set contains it. Does nothing otherwise.
        Parameters:
        featureName - A defined feature name, such as SERVER_ACCOUNTS or CLIENT_SCENARIO_VERSION
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if featureName is null or ""
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • findMissingAgainst

        public java.lang.String findMissingAgainst(SOCFeatureSet otherSet,
                                           boolean stopAtFirstFound)
        Compare this set against another; does it contain all the features of the other? For features with an int value, value in this set must be >= the feature's value in otherSet. If somehow the feature is boolean in one set and int-valued in the other, 0 is used as the boolean feature's int value.
        Parameters:
        otherSet - Feature set to compare against, or null
        stopAtFirstFound - True if caller needs to know only if any features are missing, but doesn't need the full list. Will stop checking after finding any missing feature.
        Returns:
        null if this set is a superset containing all features in otherSet, or if otherSet is null.
        Otherwise, the list of "missing" features which are in otherSet but not this set, separated by SEP_CHAR but not preceded/followed by it like getEncodedList() does. Within the returned list, items will be in the same order as in otherSet.getEncodedList(). If stopAtFirstFound, might return one missing feature instead of the full list.
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • getEncodedList

        public java.lang.String getEncodedList()
        Get the encoded list of all active features, to send to a client or server for SOCFeatureSet(String).

        Features are separated by SEP_CHAR. Integer-valued features are encoded as featurename=value. If not null or empty, the list starts and ends with SEP_CHAR for ease of search.

        Example: ";6pl;sb;sc=2000;"

        Returns:
        The active features list, or null if none

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Human-readable representation of active features. Based on super.toString + featureList. Possible Formats:
        • soc.util.SOCFeatureSet@86c347{;accts;ch;}
        • soc.util.SOCFeatureSet@f7e6a96{(empty)}
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
